info.title: HashiCorp Vault API
info.description: HTTP API that gives you full access to Vault. All API routes are prefixed with `/v1/`.

/creds/{role}.description: Request Service Principal credentials for a given Vault role.

/roles/{name}.description: Manage the Vault roles used to generate Azure credentials.

get.summary: Manage the Vault roles used to generate Azure credentials.

post.summary: Manage the Vault roles used to generate Azure credentials.

delete.summary: Manage the Vault roles used to generate Azure credentials.

/rotate-root.description: Attempt to rotate the root credentials used to communicate with Azure.

client_id.description: The OAuth2 client id to connect to Azure. This value can also be provided with the AZURE_CLIENT_ID environment variable.

client_secret.description: The OAuth2 client secret to connect to Azure. This value can also be provided with the AZURE_CLIENT_SECRET environment variable.

environment.description: The Azure environment name. If not provided, AzurePublicCloud is used. This value can also be provided with the AZURE_ENVIRONMENT environment variable.

password_policy.description: Name of the password policy to use to generate passwords for dynamic credentials.

root_password_ttl.description: The TTL of the root password in Azure. This can be either a number of seconds or a time formatted duration (ex: 24h, 48ds)

subscription_id.description: The subscription id for the Azure Active Directory. This value can also be provided with the AZURE_SUBSCRIPTION_ID environment variable.

tenant_id.description: The tenant id for the Azure Active Directory. This value can also be provided with the AZURE_TENANT_ID environment variable.

application_object_id.description: Application Object ID to use for static service principal credentials.

azure_groups.description: JSON list of Azure groups to add the service principal to.

azure_roles.description: JSON list of Azure roles to assign.

max_ttl.description: Maximum time a service principal. If not set or set to 0, will use system default.

permanently_delete.description: Indicates whether new application objects should be permanently deleted. If not set, objects will not be permanently deleted.

persist_app.description: Persist the app between generated credentials. Useful if the app needs to maintain owner ship of resources it creates

ttl.description: Default lease for generated credentials. If not set or set to 0, will use system default.
